cyclone.name: NATE
cyclone.current_location: about 25 mi SSW of San Andres Island and 210 mi SSE of Cabo Gracias a Dios on the Nicaragua/Honduras border
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to move northwest across Nicaragua and Honduras, enter the north-western Caribbean, then accelerate northward into the Gulf of Mexico and toward the north-central Gulf Coast (around Alabama/Mississippi) late Saturday into early Sunday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-central Gulf Coast near the Alabama–Mississippi border (close to Mobile Bay)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in the United States (current watches limited to Nicaragua/Honduras coast)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning in effect from Sandy Bay Sirpi, Nicaragua to Punta Castilla, Honduras
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Potential impact corridor spans the northern Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana through Mississippi, Alabama, and the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm force winds possible late Saturday night into Sunday; hurricane-force gusts cannot be ruled out if Nate intensifies faster than forecast.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential 3–6 ft surge in Mobile Bay and adjacent Alabama coast around the time of landfall.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–6 inches of rain with isolated higher totals possible, leading to localized flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Very rough seas and dangerous marine conditions; isolated tornadoes in outer rainbands as the center approaches.
